info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 11:57PM EDT until September 17 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen since 1030 PM. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area through 130 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Ashland, Virginia Union University, Virginia Commonwealth University, Downtown Richmond, Mechanicsville, University Of Richmond, Randolph Macon College, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Bon Air, Hanover, Lakeside, Glen Allen, Laurel, East Highland Park, Wyndham, Bensley, Solomons Store and Longdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT WEDNESDAY

area.areaDesc: Hanover, VA; Henrico, VA; City of Richmond, VA
